action.action-desc: Mr. Al Green of Texas (for himself, Ms. Waters, Mr. Ellison, Mr. Clay, Mr. Hinojosa, Mr. Meek of Florida, Mr. Larson of Connecticut, Mr. Sires, Mr. Serrano, Mr. Pastor of Arizona, Mr. Cleaver, Mr. McGovern, Ms. Edwards of Maryland, Mr. Moran of Virginia, Mr. Carnahan, Mr. Gonzalez, and Ms. Schakowsky) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To authorize funds to prevent housing discrimination through the use of nationwide testing, to increase funds for the Fair Housing Initiatives Program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Housing Fairness Act of 2009.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall conduct a nationwide program of testing to—

paragraph.text: detect and document differences in the treatment of persons seeking to rent or purchase housing or obtain or refinance a home mortgage loan, and measure patterns of adverse treatment because of the race, color, religion, sex, familial status, disability status, or national origin of a renter, home buyer, or borrower; and
measure the prevalence of such discriminatory practices across the housing and mortgage lending markets as a whole.

subsection.text: The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall enter into agreements with qualified fair housing enforcement organizations, as such organizations are defined under subsection (h) of section 561 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 (42 U.S.C. 3616a(h)), for the purpose of conducting the testing required under subsection (a).
The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall report to Congress—

paragraph.text: on a biennial basis, the results of each round of testing required under subsection (a) along with any recommendations or proposals for legislative or administrative action to address any issues raised by such testing; and
on an annual basis, a detailed summary of the calls received by the Fair Housing Administration’s 24-hour toll-free telephone hotline.

subsection.text: The results of any testing required under subsection (a) may be used as the basis for the Secretary, or any State or local government or agency, public or private nonprofit organization or institution, or other public or private entity that the Secretary has entered into a contract or cooperative agreement with under section 561 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 (42 U.S.C. 3616a) to commence, undertake, or pursue any investigation or enforcement action to remedy any discrimination uncovered as a result of such testing.

paragraph.text: The term disability status has the same meaning given the term handicap in section 802 of the Civil Rights Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3602).
The term familial status has the same meaning given that term in section 802 of the Civil Rights Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3602).

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out the provisions of this section $20,000,000 for fiscal year 2010 and each fiscal year thereafter.

section.header: Increase in funding for the Fair Housing Initiatives Program
section.text: Section 561 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 (42 U.S.C. 3616a) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by inserting qualified before private nonprofit fair housing enforcement organizations,; and

paragraph.text: by striking subsection (g) and inserting the following:
There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out the provisions of this section $52,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2010 through 2014, of which—

subparagraph.text: not more than 10 percent of such amounts shall be for education and outreach programs under subsection (d); and

paragraph.text: Any amount appropriated under this section shall remain available until expended.

section.text: It is the sense of Congress that the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development should—

paragraph.text: fully comply with the requirements of section 561(d) of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 (42 U.S.C. 3616a(d)) to establish, design, and maintain a national education and outreach program to provide a centralized, coordinated effort for the development and dissemination of the fair housing rights of individuals who seek to rent, purchase, sell, or facilitate the sale of a home;
utilize all amounts appropriated for such education and outreach program under section 561(g) of such Act; and

promulgate regulations regarding the fair housing obligations of each recipient of Federal housing funds to affirmatively further fair housing, as that term is defined under title VIII of the Civil Rights Act of 1968 (42 U.S.C. 3601 et seq.).

section.header: Grants to private entities to study housing discrimination

subsection.text: The Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall carry out a competitive matching grant program to assist private nonprofit organizations in—

paragraph.text: conducting comprehensive studies that examine—

subparagraph.text: the causes of housing discrimination and segregation; and
the effects of housing discrimination and segregation on education, poverty, and economic development; and

paragraph.text: implementing pilot projects that test solutions that will help prevent or alleviate housing discrimination and segregation.

subsection.text: To be eligible to receive a grant under this section, a private nonprofit organization shall—

paragraph.text: submit an application to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, containing such information as the Secretary shall require; and
agree to provide matching non-Federal funds for 25 percent of the total amount of the grant, which matching funds may include items donated on an in-kind contribution basis.

subsection.text: In awarding any grant under this section, the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development shall give preference to any applicant who is—

paragraph.text: a qualified fair housing enforcement organization, as such organization is defined under subsection (h) of section 561 of the Housing and Community Development Act of 1987 (42 U.S.C. 3616a(h)); or
a partner of any such organization.

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out the provisions of this section $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2010 through 2014.
